Come, O faithful, to praise Christ and glorify Virgin Mary, the Mother of God.

Everyone honors the pure chaste mother of the King of Glory, O Virgin Mary.

You are ever more exalted than all the high ranks, luminous orders, and angelic hosts, O Virgin Mary. The Psalmist David lifted up his voice playing his harp in the Book of the Psalms. The sweet hymnist says, â€œThe queen stood at the right of the King, dressed in glory and brightness.â€?

He also says, â€œListen, O daughter, consider and incline your ear. Forget your own people and your father's house for the King has desired your beauty, because He is your Lord, and He shall come and dwell in you.â€? Jesus, our true God, who came and took flesh for our salvation, was incarnate of the Holy Spirit and of the Virgin Mary, the pure bride.

Hail to you, O Mary, the mother of Immanuel. Hail to you, O Mary, the salvation of our father Adam. Hail to you, O Mary, the mother who is our refuge. Hail to you, O Mary, the joy of Eve. Hail to you, O Mary, the joy of generations. Hail to you, O Mary, the joy of righteous Abel.

Hail to you, O Mary, the true Virgin. Hail to you, O Mary, the salvation of Noah. Hail to you, O Mary, the calm and undefiled. Hail to you, O Mary, the grace of Abraham. Hail to you, O Mary, the unfading crown. Hail to you, O Mary, the salvation of pure Isaac.

Hail to you, O Mary, the mother of the Holy. Hail to you, O Mary, the joy of Jacob. Hail to you, O Mary, myriads of myriads. Hail to you, O Mary, the pride of Judah. Hail to you, O Mary, the mother of the Master. Hail to you, O Mary, the preaching of Moses. Hail to you, O Mary, the mother of the King.

Hail to you, O Mary, the dignity of Samuel the prophet. Hail to you, O Mary, the pride of Israel. Hail to you, O Mary, the steadfastness of Job the righteous. Hail to you, O Mary, the precious stone. Hail to you, O Mary, the mother of the Beloved. Hail to you, O Mary, the daughter of King David.

Hail to you, O Mary, the friend of Solomon. Hail to you, O Mary, the exaltation of the just. Hail to you, O Mary, the redemption of Isaiah. Hail to you, O Mary, the healing of Jeremiah. Hail to you, O Mary, the knowledge of Ezekiel. Hail to you, O Mary, the grace of Daniel.

Hail to you, O Mary, the power of Elijah. Hail to you, O Mary, the grace of Elisha. Hail to you, O Mary, the Mother of God. Hail to you, O Mary, the mother of Jesus Christ. Hail to you, O Mary, the beautiful dove. Hail to you, O Mary, the mother of the Son of God.

Hail to you, O Mary, who was witnessed by all the prophets, saying, â€˜Behold, God the Word was incarnate of you in an indescribable unity. She conceived and bore God the Word without mingling or mixing. You were truly exalted more than the rod of Aaron, O full of grace.

Who is the rod, but Mary, because it is a symbol of her virginity. She conceived the invisible, the Son of the Most High, the Word Himself.â€™ Ask your beloved Son, to grant us the forgiveness of our sins.â€? Amen.
